heisigStory: First take the primitive meaning of this character: knot. Think of it as the piglet minus its body (the horizontal stroke), that is, the curly tail that looks like a knot. As an exception, we will use the homonym to remember the abstract key word, not.
koohiiStory1: This kanji is NOT a piglett.
koohiiStory2: The butcher is standing over the piglet. "This is a piglet...(cuts of head)...NOT!".
